intro: Platylepis laxa, commonly known as the slender-leaved dune grass, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in loose clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing sand dunes. Due to its adaptability and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in coastal gardens for erosion control.
